comments:
Description:
Pull a dataset into the layout, preview in designer there is anothing displayed.

Steps:
1, Create a sample datasource. create a dataset with sql statement "select * 
from CLASSICMODELS.EMPLOYEES"
2, Pull the dataset to the layout of the designer.
3, Preview, there is nothing displayed.

Note:

The problem is the user can not pull a dataset to the layout.

If there's anything I can do to help test fixes/find the bug let me know.
Changing Severity from Major to Enhancement since we currently do not support the Mac platform.

(In reply to comment #4)
> The exception will appear even drag a single data column.
> 
> Qiangsheng:
> This obviously is not a Model exception.
> 
> Check you code in
> ReportTemplateTransferDropTargetListener
> {
>         private Object getSingleTransferData( Object template )
>         {
>                 if ( template instanceof Object[] )
>                 {
>                         return ( (Object[]) template )[0];
>                 }
>                 return template;
>         }
> }
> 
> The Exception [java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 0] indicates that
> the template parameter is an empty array, access an empty array cause the
> exception.
> 
> What do you think? 
> 

Hi Rock, as you mentioned, the Exception does throw from the method "private Object getSingleTransferData( Object template )" in our designer codes. But did you noticed the stacktrace:

...
org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.internal.ui.palette.ReportTemplateTransferDropT
argetListener.getFactory(ReportTemplateTransferDropTargetListener.java:73)
at org.eclipse.gef.dnd.TemplateTransferDropTargetListener.createTargetRequest
(TemplateTransferDropTargetListener.java:50)
...

The method getSingleTransferData( Object template ) is called by method "getFactory( Object template )" (which is also our codes), but the parameter "template" is obtained by "TemplateTransfer.getInstance().getTemplate()", which is the code at "org.eclipse.gef.dnd.TemplateTransferDropTargetListener.createTargetRequest()".

We have wrote some simple code to trace the "template" transmited from GEF when draging data column, and found the GEF gave us an empty array. So right now I don't think the problem happened in our designer codes. However, we needs to research further to see whether GEF does have problem in Mac OS X.

(In reply to comment #6)
> If there's anything I can do to help test fixes/find the bug let me know.
> 
Hi Tim, could you please have a look at what I said in comment #8? And would you please join us together to see the problem? I hope to make it clear whether GEF cause the error.
Thanks a lot for your time!

Fixed.
This bug is caused by the implementation of org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Tree towards Mac. With the Tree's such kind implementaion, when user drag a selected object and move it still in the source View, and if the View is a Tree, the method getSelection() of Tree will set the selected object as "null". 

We added a ArrayList to store the selected object when it is first draged, and set the drag source data using this ArrayList. By this way, remove the effect mentioned above. 

To QA
This bug's fixing needs to tested in Windows, Linux and Mac OS X, to see if our modification doesn't cause problem except for Mac. And we have tested it in Windows, it works well.
